expert.name: Joel Greene

nutrition_principles.guidance: Eat fruit in the morning on an empty stomach, combined with protein (collagen). This shifts gut bacteria favorably and improves metabolic response to carbs throughout the day.
Consume resistant starch (cooled potatoes, green bananas, plantains) in the evening. This feeds beneficial bacteria overnight and improves morning blood sugar.
Front-load protein earlier in the day. Eat your largest protein serving at lunch rather than dinner for optimal muscle protein synthesis.
Eat 30+ different plant foods per week. Diversity in plants creates diversity in gut bacteria. Include roots, leaves, seeds, and fungi.
Include naturally fermented foods daily (sauerkraut, kimchi, kefir). These provide transient bacteria that support immune function.
Eat whole apples with skin regularly. Apple peel contains ursolic acid, quercetin, and pectin that support AMPK and gut health.
Eliminate processed foods and seed oils. These disrupt gut barrier and promote inflammation. Cook with stable fats (olive oil, butter, coconut oil).
